channel.title: Posts on Fluency

item.title: Syntax Highlighting
item.description:
function helloWorld () {
  alert("Hello, World!")
}

item.title: Markdown Syntax
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Emojis Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways. The emojify function can be called directly in templates or Inline Shortcodes. To enable emoji globally, set enableEmoji to true in your siteâ€™s configuration and then you can type emoji shorthand codes directly in content files; e.g. ðŸ™ˆ ðŸ™ˆ ðŸ™‰ ðŸ™‰ ðŸ™Š ðŸ™Š The Emoji cheat sheet is a useful reference for emoji shorthand codes. N.B. The above steps enable Unicode Standard emoji characters and sequences in Hugo, however the rendering of these glyphs depends on the browser and the platform.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.
